national_motto:
{{nowrap|لا إله إلا الله، محمد رسول الله}}
' {{transl|ar|Lā ʾilāha ʾillāl–lāh, Muhammadun rasūl allāh}} '
'There is no god but God; Muhammad is the messenger of God.' {{efn|The ''[[Shahada|Shahādah]]'' (|lang-ar|شَـهَـادَة|, statement of faith) is sometimes translated into English as 'There is no god but Allah', using the [[romanization]] of the [[Arabic language|Arabic]] word ''[[Allah|Allāh]]'' instead of its translation. The word ''Allāh'' (|lang-ar|ٱلله|) literally translates as ''the God'', as the prefix 'Al-' is the definite article.|ref| * {{cite web|url=https://www.pbs.org/empires/islam/faithgod.html |title=God |work=Islam: Empire of Faith |publisher=PBS}} * 'Islam and Christianity', ''Encyclopedia of Christianity'' (2001): Arabic-speaking Christians and Jews also refer to God as ''Allah''. * {{Cite encyclopedia |title=Allah |encyclopedia=Encyclopaedia of Islam Online |author=L. Gardet}}|}} ([[Shahada]]) {{lang-ar|شَـهَـادَة}} , statement of faith) is sometimes translated into English as 'There is no god but Allah', using the [[romanization]] of the [[Arabic language|Arabic]] word ''[[Allah|Allāh]]'' instead of its translation. The word ''Allāh'' ( {{lang-ar|ٱلله}} ) literally translates as ''the God'', as the prefix 'Al-' is the definite article.
national_anthem:
{{lang|ar|النشيد الوطني السعودي}}
"[[National Anthem of Saudi Arabia| {{transl|ar|an-Našīd al-Waṭanī as-Saʻūdī}} ]]"
"National Anthem of Saudi Arabia"
[[File:Saudi Arabian national anthem, performed by the United States Navy Band.oga|center]]
legislature: [[#Monarchy and royal family|None]] {{efn|Legislation is by [[Rule by decree|king's decree]]. The [[Consultative Assembly of Saudi Arabia|Consultative Assembly]] exists to advise the king.}}
established_event2: [[United Nations Charter|Admitted]] [[United Nations Conference on International Organization|to the]] [[United Nations]]
